body: Nobody wants to admit such a terrible thing out loud, but m_c will not be missed by the whole Clan. r_c wanders past the vigil being held for {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, pointedly ignoring it.

r_c approaches the clearing where m_c's body lies, cold and lifeless. Defying expectations of sympathy and grief, r_c instead curses {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} fallen Clanmate to the Dark Forest where {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/belong/belongs}.
r_c wanders past m_c's vigil. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} won't mourn m_c's passing.
Frankly, they're all better off without m_c, and r_c doesn't know why everyone else is so grief-stricken.
As much as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} hated m_c, the sight of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} body still fills r_c with dread.
Yes, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} hated m_c, but m_c was {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} Clanmate first and foremost, and r_c bows {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} head at the vigil respectfully.
r_c spends m_c's vigil pretending to look sad while daydreaming about life free of that fox-heart.
r_c tries to think of something nice to say about {PRONOUN/m_c/object} at m_c's vigil, but comes up empty-pawed.
r_c doesn't bother showing up to m_c's vigil.
r_c acts strangely aloof at m_c's vigil.
It was no secret that r_c hated m_c. No cat is surprised when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} barely {VERB/r_c/make/makes} an appearance at the vigil.
r_c mourns m_c the same as the rest of c_n, but in the coming days, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/bounce/bounces} back easily from the loss.
r_c looks at m_c's body and feels nothing but scorn. Good riddance.
r_c is conflicted about m_c's death. After all, m_c did a lot of terrible things, but {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} also did one great thing for c_n: {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} died.
r_c blinks at a Clanmate who tries to offer {PRONOUN/r_c/object} condolences in the wake of m_c's death. Why would r_c care? That good-for-nothing mangepelt can rot.
r_c doesn't show up to m_c's vigil. The best thing {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can say about m_c is that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} dead.
r_c remains at m_c's vigil for the minimum required time to at least look somewhat sorry {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} dead.
As news spreads around c_n of m_c's death, r_c wonders aloud why any cat would care.
Relief crashes over r_c, knowing that m_c is finally dead and gone.
After m_c's vigil, r_c tucks into {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} nest for the best sleep of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} life.
r_c feels guilty when a Clanmate tells {PRONOUN/r_c/object} that m_c is dead, but brushes it off. All of c_n should be glad to be rid of that mouse-brain.
If anything, r_c's just surprised it took m_c this long to get {PRONOUN/m_c/self} killed.
